entries.name: new(name, policy = {}, opt = {})
entries.desc: Create a new Gem::Security::Policy object with the given mode and options.

entries.name: check_cert(signer, issuer, time)
entries.desc: Ensures that signer is valid for time and was signed by the issuer. If the issuer is nil no verification is performed.

entries.name: check_chain(chain, time)
entries.desc: Verifies each certificate in chain has signed the following certificate and is valid for the given time.

entries.name: check_data(public_key, digest, signature, data)
entries.desc: Verifies that data matches the signature created by public_key and the digest algorithm.

entries.name: check_key(signer, key)
entries.desc: Ensures the public key of key matches the public key in signer

entries.name: check_root(chain, time)
entries.desc: Ensures the root certificate in chain is self-signed and valid for time.

entries.name: check_trust(chain, digester, trust_dir)
entries.desc: Ensures the root of chain has a trusted certificate in trust_dir and the digests of the two certificates match according to digester

entries.name: verify(chain, key = nil, digests = {}, signatures = {}, full_name = '(unknown)')
entries.desc: For full_name, verifies the certificate chain is valid, the digests match the signatures signatures created by the signer depending on the policy settings.

entries.name: verify_signatures(spec, digests, signatures)
entries.desc: Extracts the certificate chain from the spec and calls verify to ensure the signatures and certificate chain is valid according to the policy..
